content: Belgian startup Ravical has raised €7.3 million in pre-seed funding to develop AI agents capable of automating up to 80% of tasks in professional services firms like tax, legal, accounting, and insurance. These AI tools handle repetitive, time-consuming work such as retrieving data, checking regulations, or analyzing policies, enabling human experts to focus on higher-value activities and client engagement. Importantly, Ravical emphasizes that its agents suggest decisions rather than act autonomously, ensuring traceable and auditable outputs critical in regulated industries. For business leaders, this innovation signals a growing trend in "agentic AI," which is shifting from emerging technology to a strategic priority for driving efficiency and scalability in knowledge-intensive sectors.
